text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the learner will still remain on the provisional license if they fail the practical test. The candidate answer correctly implies this by stating, \"If you are only holding a UK *provisional* licence (the one you use while you\u2019re learning to drive) and you have **not** passed the practical test, you are **not allowed to drive alone**...\" and later, \"If you have *only* a UK provisional licence and have **failed** the practical test, you **do not have a valid licence to drive alone**.\" However, it does not explicitly state the status of the provisional license itself (i.e., that it remains a provisional license). It focuses on the *consequence* of failing (inability to drive alone) rather than the *status* of the license remaining provisional.", "criterion_id": "3d6c8cff-c923-4c16-b2f6-af9ca4ba5a1e"}
